comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content:
Henrietta Wells Livermore. She organized a meeting of suffragists at her Park Avenue apartment in 1910, which eventually became the Women's National Republican Club. www.wnrc.org/history.html New York Times, 3 August 1920, has Mrs. Arthur Livermore as a member of the Republican National Committee, exhorting women to exercise their new right to vote in a presidential election:
"You have it in your hands to win. You have new ideas, new methods in politics, and I cannot impress upon you too strongly the part you have to play in the coming campaign. You must cooperate with the men and have confidence in your own ability. The greatest work of the campaign will be the overcoming of the inertia and indifference of those who have a vote."

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: I created an entry for her in Wikipedia en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Henrietta_Wells_Livermore:
